data.title: Earnings Snapshot: Archer-Daniels-Midland profit outlook misses estimates, flags trade policy uncertainty
NXP Semiconductor had 'solid' Q4, outlook 'bit better than investors feared,' say analysts
data.description:
Shares of NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) rose about 1% premarket on Tuesday after fourth quarter results beat estimates but the outlook was seen below estimates, drawing largely neutral reactions from analysts.

KeyBanc Capital Markets said NXP reported solid fourth quarter results and lower first quarter guidance, as market conditions remain challenging.

Analysts led by John Vinh said the company's fourth results reflect stable demand inAuto, while Industrial and Internet of Things, or IoT, and Mobile and Comms were below. The first quarter revenue is expected to be down 9% quarter-overquarter, lower than consensus, which likely reflects continued macro weakness in Europe.

The analysts noted that the Dutch company's first quarter revenue is expected to be $2.83B at the midpoint, below KeyBanc's estimate of $2.90B and the consensus of $2.89B. The company expects EPS to be $2.59 at midpoint, below KeyBanc's and consensus estimate of $2.68.

Bernstein kept its Market-Perform rating and $225 price target on NXP's stock.

Analysts led by Stacy Rasgon said NXP's fourth quarter results were largely in-line with consensus on revenues, gross margins and EPS, but, guidance missed across the board.

However, the analysts noted that overall they believe the results and somewhat weakoutlook were, at a high level, probably not unexpected given what they have been hearing outrecently of analog peers.

Meanwhile, Truist Securities maintained its Buy rating and $264 price target on NXP.

Analyst William Stein and his team said fourth quarter results were nearly in inline, and were "nothing too remarkable." The first quarter outlook was modestly below consensus, but considering recent feedback from their industry contacts (component buyers/sellers) and outlooks offered by other diversified analog/microcontroller units companies quarter-to-date, the outlook looks to them "a bit better than investors feared," the analysts added.

Stein and his team noted that revenue in the Automotive end market was 2.9% above consensus, better than the company's implied guidance and offsetting small misses in all other end markets.

Related stocks: STMicroelectronics (STM) +4%, Texas Instruments (TXN) and Analog Devices (ADI) and Microchip Technology (MCHP) were largely flat premarket on Tuesday.

data.title: mF International receives Nasdaq extension to regain compliance
data.description:
• mF International (NASDAQ:MFI) said it has received an extension of 180 calendar days to regain compliance with the Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement.
  • The firm's initial 180 calendar days period to regain compliance had expired.

data.title: PayPal announces new $15B stock repurchase program
data.description:
• PayPal Holdings (NASDAQ:PYPL) announced on Tuesday a new $15B stock repurchase program.
  • The payments company said the authorization comes in addition to the June 2022 stock repurchase program.
  • The old share buyback program had $4.86B remaining authorization as of December 31, 2024.
  • PYPL posted stronger-than-expected earnings and revenue and issued strong guidance, but its stock slumped 7.1% in Tuesday premarket trading as expenses exceeded the consensus estimate.

data.title: Innoviz Technologies to reduce workforce by 9%
data.description:
• Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ:INVZ) said it will reduce its workforce by ~9% as it looks to shift focus away from segments where "development efforts have reached maturity."
  • The firm said it expects the realignment to deliver cost savings of ~$12 million in 2025.
  • The company also expects to reduce its 2025 planned cash outlays by ~ $12 million on an annualized basis.
  • The cash savings are set to begin in the first quarter of 2025, with run rate savings expected to be reached by the end of the second quarter of 2025.

data.title: Herc raises dividend by 5.3% to $0.70
data.description:
• Herc (NYSE:HRI) declares $0.70/share quarterly dividend, 5.3% increase from prior dividend of $0.665.
  • Forward yield 1.42%
  • Payable March 4; for shareholders of record Feb. 18; ex-div Feb. 18.
  • See HRI Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Pfizer's 2025 guidance falls short of expectations
data.description:
• Although Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) reiterated 2025 financial guidance issued in December, the midpoints of the ranges for revenue and EPS are below consensus figures.
  • The pharmaceutical giant is projecting revenue of $61B-$64B (midpoint $62.5B) this year. Consensus is $63B. EPS is estimated at $2.80-$3.00 (midpoint $2.90). Consensus is $2.93.
  • In Q4, Pfizer beat on both the top and bottom lines.
  • In the quarter, Pfizer saw its biggest revenue gains, percentage-wise, in primary care and oncology, which both saw 27% year-over-year growth. Eliquis (apixaban), which the drugmaker markets with Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY), remained its top-selling drug, with ~$1.8B in revenue, a 14% increase compared to Q4 2023.
  • Vyndaqel and Vyndamax (tafamidis) saw the biggest year-over-year percentage gain in revenue, rising 61% to ~$1.5B.
  • The company noted it is on schedule to achieve ~$4.5B in cost savings by the end of the year as part of an ongoing cost realignment program.

data.title: VICI Properties announces new $2.5B unsecured credit facility
data.description:
VICI Properties (NYSE:VICI) announced on Tuesday the effectiveness of its new $2.5B multicurrency unsecured revolving credit facility that replaced its existing, and now terminated, unsecured revolving credit facility of the same size.

The revolving credit facility was substantially oversubscribed with strong support from 15 financial institutions.

The revolving credit facility matures on February 3, 2029, and can be extended for two successive six-month terms or one twelve-month term.

Based on a pricing grid and the company’s current credit ratings and leverage ratios, the revolving credit facility currently bears interest at a rate of 85 basis points over the SOFR rate or, in the case of borrowings in a foreign currency, the corresponding index rate for such currency.

In addition, based on the company’s current credit ratings and leverage ratios, the revolving credit facility requires the payment of a facility fee of 20.0 basis points of total commitments.

The company has an option to increase the revolving credit facility by up to $1B, to the extent that any one or more lenders agree to provide such additional credit extensions.

data.title: KKR & Co. declares $0.175 dividend
data.description:
• KKR & Co. (NYSE:KKR) declared $0.175/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous.
  • Forward yield 0.43%
  • Payable Feb. 28; for shareholders of record Feb. 14; ex-div Feb. 14.
  • Beginning with the dividend to be announced with the results of the quarter ending March 31, 2025, KKR intends to increase its regular annualized dividend per share of common stock from $0.70 to $0.74.
  • See KKR Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Comstock subsidiary approved for $152M allocation for Oklahoma qualified private activity bonds
data.description:
• Comstock (NYSE:LODE) announced that its subsidiary, Comstock Fuels, was approved by the Oklahoma State Treasurer’s Office to issue up to $152M in qualified private activity bonds.
  • This overall approval by the Oklahoma State Treasurer’s Office comes under the Oklahoma Private Activity Bond Allocation Act and would consist of allocations from the Oklahoma Economic Development Pool, the Oklahoma Exempt Facilities Pool, and the Oklahoma Carryforward Pool.
  • LODE shares rise 5.5% premarket on Tuesday.
  • Source: Press release
